etymologies: late Middle English (in barbel (sense 2)): via Old French from late Latin barbellus, diminutive of barbus ‘barbel’, from barba ‘beard’

definitions: a fleshy filament growing from the mouth or snout of a fish.
shortDefinitions: fleshy filament growing from mouth or snout of fish

definitions: a large European freshwater fish of the minnow family that has fleshy filaments hanging from its mouth. It lives in running water.
shortDefinitions: large European freshwater fish of carp family

definitions: an African marine or freshwater fish with barbels around the mouth.

notes.text: Species in several families, including Tachysurus feliceps (family Aniidae), of southern African coasts and estuaries, whose toxin-coated spines can inflict a dangerous wound

shortDefinitions: African marine or freshwater fish with barbels round mouth
